definition: variant of 嘗|尝[chang2]/to taste/to experience
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
lit. to lie on firewood and taste gall (idiom); fig. suffering patiently, but firmly resolved on revenge
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge/also written 淺嘗輒止|浅尝辄止
dilettante/amateur/to dabble in/to flirt with (a topic)

sentences.english: Even when we reduce the salt to a fine powder , it will taste well.
sentences.chinese: 即使我們把鹽研磨成很小的粉末，他嚐起來還是鹹的。

sentences.english: He discovered, by some accident, that flesh roasted in front of afire tasted better.
sentences.chinese: 他意外地發現，在火前烤過的肉嚐起來更好。

sentences.english: You can taste the wind and rain of India's stormy season in each cup through its earthiness .
sentences.chinese: 嚐起來有土味，能聞到印度多雨季節風和雨的味道。

sentences.english: I think you cooked this chicken too long. It tastes really dry.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲你煮雞煮得太久了，嚐起來真的好乾。

sentences.english: and you can eat some of the barley-sugar window, it tastes so nice.
sentences.chinese: 你可以喫一些麥芽糖做的窗戶，它嚐起來太美味了。

sentences.english: The guests left most of the dishes untouched, because they didn't taste delicious.
sentences.chinese: 客人們沒有動大部分菜，因爲它們嚐起來味道不咋樣。

sentences.english: The dish sells like fish, but tastes like beef.
sentences.chinese: 這道菜聞起來像魚，嚐起來像牛肉。

sentences.english: Thee dish sells like fish, but tastes like beef.
sentences.chinese: 這道菜聞起來像魚，嚐起來像牛肉。

sentences.english: You've tasted bitter defeat and the sweet success.
sentences.chinese: 你嚐盡了失敗的痛楚，成功的喜悅。

sentences.english: We drink, and it tastes divine.
sentences.chinese: 我們喝下去，它嚐起來是神聖的。

sentences.english: Think about the benefit of old books on the shop, taste all dark alex also stay airflow.
sentences.chinese: 想想網店上那實惠的舊書，嚐盡甜頭也留得半世風流。

sentences.english: How does this soup taste? It tastes a little salty.
sentences.chinese: 這湯嚐起來怎麼樣？有點鹹。

sentences.english: Churine (548): The leaf from its head, when chewed, is extremely bitter, but it has the effect of energizing a tired body.
sentences.chinese: 在它頭上的葉子嚐起來非常苦，但是會給予人力量。

definition: variant of 熱乎乎|热乎乎[re4 hu1 hu1]
leaving a rich aftertaste/(fig.) memorable/lingering in memory
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
dilettante/amateur/to dabble in/to flirt with (a topic)
